3. Reference¶

3.1. qualib/¶

3.1.1. log.py¶

class qualib.log.Log¶

Logs timestamped and labeled informations (“info”), debug informations (“debug”), warnings (“warn”), errors (“error”), and/or custom content.

Keyword arguments **kwargs are not supported yet, but may be added in future versions.

initialize(timestamp, max_label_len=5)¶

Sets self.path and self.max_label_len.

Parameters

  • timestamp (str) – A user-defined timestamp.

  • max_label_len (int) – Defaults to 5.

info(prefix, *args, **kwargs)¶

Calls log('info', *args, **kwargs).

debug(prefix, *args, **kwargs)¶

Calls log('debug', *args, **kwargs).

warn(prefix, *args, **kwargs)¶

Calls log('warn', *args, **kwargs).

error(prefix, *args, **kwargs)¶

Calls log('error', *args, **kwargs).

exc()¶

Logs the current exception traceback with an [ERROR] label.

log(label, prefix, *args, **kwargs)¶

Logs its arguments.

Multiples lines may be passed to this method

  • As a list: log(label, lines), e.g. log('info', [line1, line2, line3])

  • As multiple arguments: log(label, *lines), e.g. log('info', line1, line2, line3).

json(obj)¶

Returns an indented string representation of an object.

Parameters

obj (list or dict) – Object to stringify.

3.1.2. load.py¶

qualib.load.load_calibration_scheme(log, path)¶
Returns

Parsed calibration sequence, raw calibration sequence.

Return type

tuple (dict, str)

qualib.load.load_exopy_template(log, calib, sub)¶
Returns

Contents of the Exopy template for a given calibration name.

Return type

str

qualib.load.load_assumptions(log)¶
Returns

Assumptions before any calibration.

Return type

dict

qualib.load.load_utils(log, calib, sub)¶
Returns

Calibration class from CALIBRATION_NAME_utils.py.

Return type

Calibration

3.1.3. main.py¶

class qualib.main.Qualib¶

Wrapper supclass.

run(log, report, assumptions, calib_id, calib_name, subs_name, subs_misc)¶

Runs a single calibration with given assumptions and Exopy template.

Parameters

  • log (Log) –

  • report (Report) –

  • calibration_id (int) – A natural number giving the rank of the calibration to run.

  • calibration_name (str) – The name of the calibration to run.

  • substitutions (dict) – The dictionary of substitutions.

  • assumptions (dict) – The current state of the assumptions (updated after each calibration).

Returns

None

run_all(pkg_calib_scheme)¶

Runs a calibration sequence whose path is either passed:

  • As pkg_calib_scheme — package usage: Qualib().run_all('calibration_scheme.py')

  • Or in sys.argv — CLI/module usage: python qualib.main calibration_scheme.py.

Parameters

pkg_calib_scheme (str, optional) – path to the Python file defining the calibration sequence to run.

Returns

None

3.1.4. calibrations/default.py¶

qualib.calibrations.default.keep_cell(src)¶

Handles conditional cells: skips a given cell if its first line is #if condition: and condition evaluates to False.

class qualib.calibrations.default.DefaultCalibration(log, report, calib_id, calib_name)¶

Defines the code shared between all calibrations.

  • report (Report) –

  • calib_id (int) –

  • calib_name (str) –

Handles pre-placeholders. Should be called at the end of Calibration.pre_process().

  • report (Report) –

post_process(log, report, calib_name, mapping)¶

Handles post-placeholders. Should be called at the end of Calibration.post_process().

Parameters

  • report (Report) –

  • calib_name (str) –

  • mapping (dict) – Dictionary of 'POST_PLACEHOLDER': value pairs.

Returns

class qualib.calibrations.default.Report(filename, assumptions, calib_scheme_str)¶

Generates and updates a Jupyter notebook to report the calibrations results.

Parameters

  • filename (str) – Report filename.

  • assumptions (dict) – State of the assumptions before the calibrations.

  • calib_scheme_str (str) – String representation of the calibration sequence.

header¶

List of cells defined in qualib/calibrations/default_header.py.

Type

list

filename¶
Type

str

cells¶
Type

notebook¶
assumptions_before¶
Type

str

assumptions_after¶
Type

str

update()¶

Overwrites self.notebook from the list of cells self.cells.

Returns

self.

Return type

Report

add_calibration()¶

Appends a calibration to the report.

Returns

self.

Return type

Report

Reports results from the previous calibration.

Parameters

assumptions (dict) – Dictionary of assumptions.

Returns

self.

self.

Inserts a Python cell in the report.

3.2. qualib/calibrations/NAME/¶

3.2.1. NAME_utils.py¶

class qualib.calibrations.NAME.NAME_utils.Calibration¶

Inherits from, and overrides, qualib.calibrations.default.DefaultCalibration.

handle_substitutions()¶
pre_process()¶
process()¶
post_process()¶

3.3. reports/¶

Each report consists in:

  • Calibration sequence (Report.__init__())

  • Assumptions before calibration sequence (Report.__init__())

  • Assumptions after calibration sequence (Report.add_results())

  • Assumptions diff (Report.add_results())

  • Report header (imports, utility functions) (Report.__init__())

  • Calibrations reports (Report.add_calibration(), Report.add_results())

3.4. logs/¶

Logs consist in timestamped and labeled lines of information (“info”), debug information (“debug”), warning (“warn”), errors (“error”) and/or custom content.
